psalm.title: Book of Isaiah
psalm.text:
[[Is 12,2]]God indeed is my savior; 
I am confident and unafraid. 
My strength and my courage is the LORD, 
and he has been my savior.

[[Is 12,3]]With joy you will draw water 
at the fountain of salvation.
[[Is 12,4b]]Give thanks to the LORD, acclaim his name;
[[Is 12,4c]]among the nations make known his deeds,
[[Is 12,4d]]proclaim how exalted is his name.

[[Is 12,5]]Sing praise to the LORD for his glorious achievement; 
let this be known throughout all the earth.
[[Is 12,6]]Shout with exultation, O city of Zion, 
for great in your midst 
is the Holy One of Israel!

second_reading.title: Letter to the Ephesians
second_reading.text:
[[Ep 3,8]]Brothers and sisters: to me, the very least of all the holy ones, this grace was given, to preach to the Gentiles the inscrutable riches of Christ,
[[Ep 3,9]]and to bring to light (for all) what is the plan of the mystery hidden from ages past in God who created all things,
[[Ep 3,10]]so that the manifold wisdom of God might now be made known through the church to the principalities and authorities in the heavens.
[[Ep 3,11]]This was according to the eternal purpose that he accomplished in Christ Jesus our Lord,
[[Ep 3,12]]in whom we have boldness of speech and confidence of access through faith in him.
[[Ep 3,14]]For this reason I kneel before the Father,
[[Ep 3,15]]from whom every family in heaven and on earth is named,
[[Ep 3,16]]that he may grant you in accord with the riches of his glory to be strengthened with power through his Spirit in the inner self,
[[Ep 3,17]]and that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith; that you, rooted and grounded in love,
[[Ep 3,18]]may have strength to comprehend with all the holy ones what is the breadth and length and height and depth,
[[Ep 3,19]]and to know the love of Christ that surpasses knowledge, so that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
gospel.text:
[[Jn 19,31]]Since it was preparation day, in order that the bodies might not remain on the cross on the sabbath, for the sabbath day of that week was a solemn one, the Jews asked Pilate that their legs be broken and they be taken down.
[[Jn 19,32]]So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and then of the other one who was crucified with Jesus.
[[Jn 19,33]]But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs,
[[Jn 19,34]]but one soldier thrust his lance into his side, and immediately blood and water flowed out.
[[Jn 19,35]]An eyewitness has testified, and his testimony is true; he knows that he is speaking the truth, so that you also may (come to) believe.
[[Jn 19,36]]For this happened so that the scripture passage might be fulfilled: "Not a bone of it will be broken."
[[Jn 19,37]]And again another passage says: "They will look upon him whom they have pierced."

first_reading.title: Book of Hosea
first_reading.text:
[[Os 11,1]]Thus says the LORD: When Israel was a child I loved him, out of Egypt I called my son.
[[Os 11,3]]Yet it was I who taught Ephraim to walk, who took them in my arms;
[[Os 11,4]]I drew them with human cords, with bands of love; I fostered them like one who raises an infant to his cheeks; Yet, though I stooped to feed my child, they did not know that I was their healer.
[[Os 11,8c]]My heart is overwhelmed, my pity is stirred.
[[Os 11,9]]I will not give vent to my blazing anger, I will not destroy Ephraim again; For I am God and not man, the Holy One present among you; I will not let the flames consume you.
